How do adaptations for Aesop work? I have a PR (lean#8424 and lean#8467 for bootstrap testing) which breaks Aesop because of the following:
The offending line is https://github.com/leanprover-community/aesop/blob/76a782b161da3faacc43aa5471bbd2e1d262970a/Aesop/Script/SpecificTactics.lean#L104 which is a problem because in my PR I changed the syntax of unfold from unfold ident+ to unfold identWithOptDot+ (which is a variant that allows for better autocompletion) and now the unfold $usedDecls:ident* pattern fails to parse.
The fix is probably $[$usedDecls:ident]*, should I open a PR for that?
On another note, I don't really like myself how this change breaks things like these but I'm not sure how to solve the problem (autocompletion for e.g. unfold Nat.) without breaking things or using weird and bad hacks. Any ideas?
@Jannis Limperg I guess I need to ask you about this
I'd be very grateful for an Aesop adaptation PR. This kind of breakage is basically unavoidable, don't worry about it.
I've gone in a different direction now (lean#8252) so this won't be necessary anymore.
Robin Arnez has marked this topic as resolved.
